newsitem.title: JAPAN: Trade in Sumitomo Trust shares suspended.
newsitem.headline: Trade in Sumitomo Trust shares suspended.

text.p: Shares in Sumitomo Trust & Banking Co Ltd were suspended from trade on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) on Wednesday, the bourse said.
The TSE said that trade in the shares had been halted for the entire session starting from 0135 GMT, due to unclear information surrounding the issuance of preferred shares.
The shares were ask-only earlier in the session on market rumours that the trust bank is considering equity financing worth some 100 billion yen, said brokers.
Sumitomo Trust declined to comment on the rumours.
On Monday, underwriting sources told Reuters the trust bank was considering issuing euroyen convertible bonds worth some 100 billion yen in an attempt to strengthen its asset base.
But some underwriting sources said at that time that a lack of clear direction in the stock market could make the timing of the issue flexible.
